associates a sequence of catch clauses with the entire function body, and with the member initializer list (if used in a constructor) as well. Every exception thrown from any statement in the function body, or (for constructors) from any member or base constructor, or (for destructors) from any member or base destructor, transfers control to the handler-sequence the same way an exception thrown in a regular try block would.
trans-unit.target: 将一系列catch子句与整个函数主体以及成员初始值设定项列表（如果在构造函数中使用）相关联。从函数体中的任何语句抛出的每个异常，或从任何成员或基本构造函数（对于构造函数），或者从任何成员或基本析构函数的（对于析构函数）抛出的每个异常，都将控制权转移到处理程序序列，就像在对象中抛出异常一样。定期尝试块会。

Temporary materialization, however, is (formally) performed for prvalue arguments: typeid determines the type of the result object.(since C++17)

trans-unit.source: because calling std::swap(obj1, obj2) directly would not consider the user-defined swap() functions that could be defined in the same namespace as the types of obj1 or obj2, and just calling the unqualified swap(obj1, obj2) would call nothing if no user-defined overload was provided. In particular, std::iter_swap and all other standard library algorithms use this approach when dealing with Swappable types.
